node.name: Tane Eclipse Refactorings
node.shortdescription:
Eclipse provides some very good refactorings. Some codebases that http://www.stateofflow.com" title="State Of Flow home page">we have ‘inherited’ have needed more than the set of refactorings provided by Eclipse, so we decided to write those that we thought would be most beneficial.

Tane is at an early stage of development. We have only implemented three refactoring and the UI is a bit rough around the edges, but the refactorings work and are useful. If you are interested in contributing, either with more refactorings or by improving the work we’ve started, please http://groups.google.com/group/tane-eclipse-refactorings" title="Tane discussion group">get in touch.

To install Tane, please use the update site – http://www.stateofflow.com/UpdateSite">http://www.stateofflow.com/UpdateSite">http://www.stateofflow.com/Update... – or download the plugin from Google">http://code.google.com/p/tane/">Google Code. Also visit Google Code for feature requests, bug reports, etc.

Tane (pronounced ‘Tah-ney’) is a Polynesian god who lets light into the world every morning by lifting up a corner of the dark sky.
node.body:
Eclipse provides some very good refactorings. Some codebases that http://www.stateofflow.com" title="State Of Flow home page">we have ‘inherited’ have needed more than the set of refactorings provided by Eclipse, so we decided to write those that we thought would be most beneficial.

Tane is at an early stage of development. We have only implemented three refactoring and the UI is a bit rough around the edges, but the refactorings work and are useful. If you are interested in contributing, either with more refactorings or by improving the work we’ve started, please http://groups.google.com/group/tane-eclipse-refactorings" title="Tane discussion group">get in touch.

To install Tane, please use the update site – http://www.stateofflow.com/UpdateSite">http://www.stateofflow.com/UpdateSite">http://www.stateofflow.com/Update... – or download the plugin from Google">http://code.google.com/p/tane/">Google Code. Also visit Google Code for feature requests, bug reports, etc.

Tane (pronounced ‘Tah-ney’) is a Polynesian god who lets light into the world every morning by lifting up a corner of the dark sky.
